resources.string: The timeline will never save your position. It will start at the top.
All image uploads will go through TwitPic.
Allows you to use iOS emojis by downloading our Sliding Emoji Keyboard - iOS.
Displays how many tweets you are from the top of your timeline.
Tweets will not expand in-line with this option.
Muffing a user will remove the main portion of their tweet from your timelines. You will only see the name and a small chunk to give you extended access if you wish to see more.
Click a user to clear the muffle.
Consider giving it a rating or sharing it with your friends!\n\nYour 5 star reviews warm my heart :)
Applied when Talon Pull is turned on.
Apps are not able to accurately find whether some devices have a navigation bar or not. Since Talon relies heavily on this for layouts, this option allows you to manually specify it.
To open the tweet that accompanies a picture, simply long click the picture on this grid.\n\nA normal click will open the picture viewer.
The twitter status link will be shown as an embedded tweet on modern Twitter clients. The link acts as the quoted tweet.
A background refresh interval must be turned on for these notifications to occur.
A background refresh interval for the home timeline, or live streaming, must be enabled for favorite user notifications.
How you want to be notified: vibrate, sound, LED, etc.
To close a window on the tablet, simply click the dimmed area outside the window.\n\nThis ensures your timeline is never too far away!

Talon is about to ask you for authorization on two permissions: location and storage.


- Location is used to access local trends as well as tag your location in your tweets (if you request it too). I do not save your location at any time.
 - Storage is used to save tweet images to the external storage (when requested) and is used when uploading your images to Twitter.


Feel free to decline either permission. You can manually access these from your system's app settings.
Tip: simply swipe down to close this screen.
This will make it so the app bar, compose FAB, and snackbar do not disappear when scrolling.
This will perform a background sync for any lists that you use as extra pages on the main timeline.
Set the style of pictures you want to see as you scroll your timeline.
Thanks! Your support is immensely appreciated. If there is anything I can do, don\'t hesitate to ask.
Automatic TweetMarker will always refresh the timeline on startup of the app.
No preview is available for this video service.
Automatically play Twitter GIFs and videos without leaving the timeline.
Max number of tweets to store for a swipable list, in the database.
How you want your tweets to look on the timeline.
Notifications can be triggered after these background refreshes have finished.
TweetMarker can be used to sync your current timeline position between devices.
This will download images after a background refresh, so that they are immediately available in the app.
These notifications will go off after a background refresh has been completed.
TweetMarker will always refresh on startup.
All preferences under \"Background Refreshes\" will also consume both battery and data.
You may need to remove, then re-add the widget to your homescreen, to apply these changes.
Disabling the in-app browser will send you to your default browser when opening links.
A replacement to Talon\'s own in-app browswer. It uses services provided by Google Chrome.
Default (No reverse actions):\n- Short Click = Expand In-Line\n- Long Click = Tweet Viewer
